element.name: Lusk Round Tower by Windsockers, Traditional Cache (1.5/1)
element.description:
This Cache is set in The Grounds of Lusk Round Tower & Heritage Center.
Please take extreme care when rehiding the cache as the area is over looked by a number of house's
element.long-description:
The round tower here is the only surviving relic of a monastery founded in the 6th century. Attached is a 16th century tower, and a church on the site contains a number of fine medieval tombs.
Lusk Heritage Centre comprises a round tower, a medieval belfry and a 19th century church. They form a unit, although they were built over a period of almost a thousand years. The belfry now houses an exhibition on medieval churches of North County Dublin and also the magnificent 16th century effigy tomb of Sir Christopher Barnewall and his wife Marion Sharl. Opening Times Date Day Time Mid June - Mid September Friday 10:00-17:00 Last admission 45 minutes before closing. Visit Length 1hr Admission Adult €1.50 Child €0.75 Student €0.75 Senior €1.00 Family €4.25 Group €1.00
The Windsockers

Found this with abra123cadabra and 123zoom. Interesting round tower. Last find of the day!

Found this with abra123cadabra and abra123zoom. Interesting round tower.

2010-05-08T19:00:00Z : Found it by abra123cadabra
Last cache for today.Nice and easy. Interesting place.

2008-09-27T19:00:00Z : Found it by Kersti.com
Found with jme1979 - would be fascinating to see a Time Team special here. I'm sure the ground was much lower and there must be some interesting stuff buried under the ground (aside from the residents).
